parameters.name: DnsRecord
parameters.description: Rewrite the DNS resolution record for the origin request.

parameters.name: OriginHost
parameters.description: The HOST carried in the origin request.

parameters.name: OriginHttpPort
parameters.description: Port of the origin server when using the HTTP protocol for origin requests.

parameters.name: OriginHttpsPort
parameters.description: Port of the origin server when using the HTTPS protocol for origin requests.

parameters.name: OriginMtls
parameters.description:
mTLS switch. Possible values:
- on: Enable.
- off: Disable.

parameters.name: OriginScheme
parameters.description:
Protocol used for the origin request. Possible values:
- http: Use HTTP protocol for origin requests.
- https: Use HTTPS protocol for origin requests.
- follow: Follow the client's protocol for origin requests.

parameters.name: OriginSni
parameters.description: SNI carried in the origin request.

parameters.name: OriginVerify
parameters.description:
Origin certificate verification switch. Possible values:
- on: Enable.
- off: Disable.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description:
Use range chunking for origin downloads. Possible values:
- on: Enable
- off: Disable
- force: Force

parameters.name: Rule
parameters.description:
Rule content, using conditional expressions to match user requests. This parameter is not required when adding global configurations. There are two usage scenarios:
- Match all incoming requests: Set the value to true
- Match specific requests: Set the value to a custom expression, for example: (http.host eq \"video.example.com\")

parameters.name: RuleEnable
parameters.description:
Rule switch. This parameter is not required when adding global configurations. Possible values:
- on: Enable.
- off: Disable.

parameters.name: RuleName
parameters.description: Rule name. This parameter is not required when adding global configurations.

parameters.name: SiteId
parameters.description: Site ID, which can be obtained by calling the [ListSites](~~ListSites~~) interface.

parameters.name: SiteVersion
parameters.description: Version number of the site configuration. For sites with version management enabled, you can use this parameter to specify the version of the site where the configuration takes effect. The default is version 0.
